title: Steven Gerrard "absolutely steaming" for Anfield return ahead of Liverpool legends clash with Real Madrid
text:
Sport Steven Gerrard "absolutely steaming" for Anfield return ahead of Liverpool legends clash with Real Madrid Gerrard hasn't played at Anfied since 2005 but is set to line-up for Liverpool against Real Madrid on March 25 and he cannot wait to get back out there Share Steven Gerrard in the stands (Photo: Reuters / Phil Noble) Share Get Liverpool FC     
Steven Gerrard cannot wait to return to the Anfield pitch next month. 
Gerrard announced his retirement in November after a spell with LA Galaxy and hasn't played at Anfield since leaving his boyhood club in 2015. 
He admits he is relishing the chance to run out in front of the Kop again. 
"I’m so excited. I think it’s a couple of years since I last played at Anfield," he said. Gerrard on his first day as Liverpool academy coach (Photo: Liverpool FC/Getty Images) Steven Gerrard looks on from the stand (Photo: Getty) 
"I’ve been to a lot of games of late and I’m absolutely steaming to get out there and play against Real Madrid and with all of my ex-teammates. I’m so excited, I can’t wait for it. 
“ I’m often asked the question what was the best buzz during your career and it was always running out at Anfield with the Liverpool shirt on in front of a full house. Gerrard on his final Liverpool appearance (Photo: Stu Forster/Getty Images) Gerrard applauds the Kop (Photo: Stu Forster) 
“Obviously there’s a new stand involved now and hopefully we can get a lot of people there to support the Foundation because that’s the key thing here. 
“It’s the main incentive. For myself and all the other players it’s the reason why we are doing it. It’s a great fixture but the key to all this is that we raise some funds, it stays in the local areas and it goes back to less fortunate people.” 
Gerrard will be joined by the likes of Jamie Carragher, Robbie Fowler and Ian Rush for the legends match. poll loading Will Steven Gerrard manage Liverpool one day? 3000+ VOTES SO FAR
